intro: Felicia barbata, commonly known as the common fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Felicia barbata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun.
